grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 斉【セイ】Qi (kingdom in China during the Spring and Autumn Period and the Period of the Warring States), Ch'i
斉唱【セイショウ】singing or chanting in unison
一斉【イッセイ】simultaneous, all at once
斎行【サイコウ】carrying out (a religious festival or ceremony)
kun reading compounds: 等しい【ひとしい】equal, identical, the same, no different (to), just like, equivalent
等しく【ひとしく】equally, evenly, similarly, alike
